SEARCH
Package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal

Class OtherFileTagletBase

java.lang.Object
org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.OtherFileTagletBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Taglet
Direct Known Subclasses:
IncludeTaglet
@ClassVersion(sourceVersion="$Id: OtherFileTagletBase.java 1013 2022-02-08 21:30:29Z tquadrat $") @API(status=STABLE, since="0.1.0") public abstract class OtherFileTagletBase extends Object implements Taglet

This class is the base class for taglet that allow to include the contents of an external file into the JavaDoc documentation. This is particularly useful when the contents of resource files (like a DTD or an XML Schema) should be shown in the documentation.

Usually, that file is stored somewhere on the SOURCE_PATH; this means that a file is addressed by its path name on the source tree. For example to include this file, the path would be org/tquadrat/foundation/javadoc/internal/OtherFileTagletBase.java.

But additional roots can be provided through system properties, where the name of the new root will be prefixed by "org.tquadrat.foundation.include.root", like org.tquadrat.foundation.include.root.resources. To use this root, prefix the path in the tag with ${resources}.

The file contents can be processed in some way before it will be included; refer to OtherFileTagletBase.ProcessMode for the details.

Notes:

  • If Maven is used, and the include file is not placed at the java path (but on the resources path, for example}, it is required to add the parameter <sourcepath> to the configuration of the maven-javadoc-plugin, where the path of the include file is added; otherwise, it will not be found. Alternatively an external root can be used, as described above.
  • At default, Gradle adds only *.java files as sources for the Javadoc task. To make other files available for the @include tag, an external root should be used. This is mandatory for files that are stored at the resources path.
  • In general, both Maven and Gradle may have funny ideas about the source path, so the recommendation is to use an external root always.
  • If the source of a class should be included, the path to the source file is relative to the module directory, if one exists.
  • The {@include} tag is an inline tag; that means that the contents of the included file will be seamlessly integrated into the other text of the respective Javadoc comment.
Author:
Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
Version:
$Id: OtherFileTagletBase.java 1013 2022-02-08 21:30:29Z tquadrat $

    • PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX

      @API(status=STABLE, since="0.1.0") public static final String PROPERTY_INCLUDE_ROOT_PREFIX
      The prefix for the name of a property that holds the root for path of an include file: "org.tquadrat.foundation.include.root". It will be set on the javadoc command line like this: 
      -J-Dorg.tquadrat.foundation.include.root.<name>=<path>
      See Also:

    • rootPathRetriever

      protected static final Optional<String> rootPathRetriever(String variable)
      Looks up the system properties for a root path for include files with the given name (the full name would be the prefix "org.tquadrat.foundation.include.root" appended by the argument, separated by a '.'.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      An instance of Optional that holds the path.
